meanings.definition: A person who makes and repairs locks.
meanings.sent1: The locksmith fixed the broken lock on my door.
meanings.sent2: I called a locksmith to help me with my jammed lock.
meanings.sent3: The locksmith joked that he held the 'key' to everyone's problems.
meanings.sent4: She was a locksmith of emotions, always knowing how to open people's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The locksmith's hands moved with precision as he crafted a new lock.

meanings.definition: A professional who specializes in opening locks without keys.
meanings.sent1: The locksmith skillfully picked the lock to gain entry.
meanings.sent2: When I lost my keys, I knew only a locksmith could help me.
meanings.sent3: The locksmith playfully teased that he could open any 'locked' mystery.
meanings.sent4: She was a locksmith of secrets, unlocking the truth behind every closed door.
meanings.sent5: The locksmith's tools gleamed as he expertly bypassed the lock.

meanings.sent1: I always locksmith my bike before leaving it outside.
meanings.sent2: Remember to locksmith the gate before you go to bed.
meanings.sent3: He tried to locksmith his diary, but his sister still managed to read it.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to locksmith her heart, but love found a way to unlock it.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was locksmithed tightly to protect its contents.
